content.description: Sit start on a low crimp rail for the left and a side pull for the right, move up to jugs and top out easily
content.location: Left side of the Best Boulder

content.description: Sit Start with hands on the incut side pull crimp and the sloping edge which appear to be the remains of a flake.  Utilize any usable feet on the little boulder, which the main boulder rests upon.  Move your knees up to set a double kneebar, and make a big reach to grab the pair of usable crimps on the face.  Move the feet up and go left hand to a good edge around the arete.  Make another set of big reaches to another set of crimps high on the face, then top out easily.
content.location: The left arete on the back side of the Best Boulder, to the left of the 45 degree roof with the crack.

content.description: You will know you are at the right spot when you see the slightly overhung roof crack as you walk around to the downhill facing side of the boulder
